nodes.title: I.1. Residential Structures Occupying Summits: Fortresses, breastworks, religious buildings, palaces, and related edifices
Oral tradition
nodes.body: Nakra DzongNag ra rdzong is said by local drok pa’brog pa to be the ancient fortress of a personality from the Subcontinent called Singpa AtsaraSing pa a tsa ra. Agriculture is supposed to have once been practiced in the NakraNag ra valley, but few signs of cultivation were detected.

nodes.title: Building group 1
nodes.body: Building group 1 is located on the west end of the summit (19.5 x 8.5 m). The remnants of wall partitions indicate that it contained large rooms or buildings aligned in the cardinal directions. The highest revetment reaches 1.1 m.

nodes.title: Building group 2
nodes.body: Building group 2 is located on the crest of the ridge 15 m to the east of BG1. It was probably composed of five rooms or interconnected buildings (21.5 m x 7 m). A foundation on the north side of BG2 is 1.5 m thick. This masonry mass must have had a special function. Some walls exhibit herringbone courses of masonry.

nodes.title: Building group 3
nodes.body: Building group 3 is located 10.4 m to the northeast of BG2. This collection of structures was built at two or more different levels on the ridge-top (38 m x 5 m to 8.5 m). Revetments attain a height of 1.2 m. A wall at he southeast corner of BG3 is 1.5 m in height, about 50% of which is freestanding. This is virtually the only part of a superstructure to survive at Nakra DzongNag ra rdzong.

nodes.title: Building group 4
nodes.body: The eastern extremity of building group 4 is adjacent to the east wall of BG3. This is the highest elevation group of structures at the site (40 m x 4 m to 6 m). The north end of BG4 is on the ridge-top, with its axis following the south slope downward.

nodes.title: Building group 5
nodes.body: The upper end of building group 5 is adjacent to the middle of the south wall of BG3. The axis of BG5 follows he southwest line of the slope, thus its structures were set at various elevations. BG5 measures 45 m x 5 m o 7 m.

nodes.title: Middle complex
nodes.body: The formation on which the middle complex sits is situated 100 m south of BG5 of the upper complex, on a smaller outcrop (5010 m). A small hanging valley intervenes between the upper complex and middle complex formations. In this valley, a highly dissolved residential structure (5 m x 9 m) was built against the base of he upper formation. Very little of even the foundations of the buildings that once comprised the middle complex remain intact. They were founded on a level shelf endowed with a natural bulwark of stone to the south. The density of structures at this location is unclear. On the east end of the middle complex summit there is a ruined house almost certainly built after the fortress was in ruins. Along the north edge of the summit are the vestiges of a defensive wall that enclosed the shelf.
